alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Campbell; Claiborne; Morgan; Scott (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 16 at 10:38PM CST until February 17 at 1:30AM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM EST FRIDAY FOR WEST CENTRAL ANDERSON, CAMPBELL, NORTHWESTERN CLAIBORNE, CENTRAL MORGAN AND EASTERN SCOTT COUNTIES... At 1138 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... La Follette, Wartburg, Jacksboro, Huntsville, Helenwood, Jellico, Caryville, Royal Blue, Norma, Smokey Junction, Cove Lake State Park, Elk Valley, Ketchen, Slick Rock, Fincastle, Indian Mountain State Park, Robbins, Petros, White Oak and Frozen Head State Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
